oldDefinition: Parity method ensuring an odd number of 1s.
newDefinition:
Any eight from:
The 1s are counted (in each byte)
Each byte has a parity bit
If the number of 1s are odd the parity bit is 0 (otherwise it is 1)
(The first packet of) data is sent and a timer is started
The receiving device counts the number of 1s (in each byte)
If the number of 1s are odd/data meets odd parity an acknowledgement is sent to say the data is error free …
… the sender then sends the next packet of data …
… and the timer is restarted
If the number of 1s is even an acknowledgement is not sent
If no acknowledgement is received within a set timeframe/before timeout …
… the data packet is resent
question: Describe operation of error detection system using odd parity and ARQ.

oldDefinition: Automatic repeat request protocol for retransmission.
newDefinition:
Any eight from:
The 1s are counted (in each byte)
Each byte has a parity bit
If the number of 1s are odd the parity bit is 0 (otherwise it is 1)
(The first packet of) data is sent and a timer is started
The receiving device counts the number of 1s (in each byte)
If the number of 1s are odd/data meets odd parity an acknowledgement is sent to say the data is error free …
… the sender then sends the next packet of data …
… and the timer is restarted
If the number of 1s is even an acknowledgement is not sent
If no acknowledgement is received within a set timeframe/before timeout …
… the data packet is resent
question: Describe operation of error detection system using odd parity and ARQ.

oldDefinition: Translates whole program to object code before execution.
newDefinition:
Two from for each compiler and interpreter.
Compiler
• Checks all code before executing any code
• Produces error report with all errors found for the whole code (before translating/running any of the code)
• Produces executable file
Interpreter
• Checks/translates one line of code and then executes it before moving on to the next line
• Stops when an error is found
• … when corrected the program can be run from the same position // allows error correction in real time
question: Describe operation of compiler and interpreter.

oldDefinition: Executes program line by line translating at runtime.
newDefinition:
Two from for each compiler and interpreter.
Compiler
• Checks all code before executing any code
• Produces error report with all errors found for the whole code (before translating/running any of the code)
• Produces executable file
Interpreter
• Checks/translates one line of code and then executes it before moving on to the next line
• Stops when an error is found
• … when corrected the program can be run from the same position // allows error correction in real time
question: Describe operation of compiler and interpreter.

oldDefinition: Domain Name System translating names to IP addresses.
newDefinition:
Any six from:
• The users type the URL into the address bar/web browser
• The web browser sends the URL to the DNS
• The DNS searches for the matching IP address
• The DNS returns the IP address to the web browser
• If the DNS cannot find the IP address it sends the URL to the next DNS
• The web browser sends a request to the IP address/web server
• The web server sends the data for the web page to the web browser
• The web browser renders the HTML data to display the web page
question: Describe how web pages are located, retrieved and displayed.
